author: Deryk Grimes
title: Food Delivery App + Low Commissions
description: Uber Eats takes advantage of restaurants and delivery drivers with 30-60% commission fees.

assessments.note: Whilst this proposal has the potential to attract many users to Cardano if its built well and marketed properly, I'm not sure that simply including Ada currency in the checkout box is enough. Why not build the whole thing on Cardano smart contract tech. Not sure if 'drivers' are also independent bike rider deliveries and any person with a Cardano DID..
Could be useful app, but who are the clients? Who wants a white label version of this software? How will you compete with Uber, Didi etc?

The proposal claims that the app is already in development with 200+ engineers. The current proposal is for creating an ADA payment system and evolving a schema to onboard non-crypto users. This experiment, if successful, has immense potential for mass adaptation of Cardano in a fast-moving segment. The methodology is unique, involving reducing the margin to the restaurants and delivery agents; therefore, it has a higher chance of adaptability.

The proposal is very innovative, because it seeks to use an existing and well-consolidated service in a more just and safe way, by involving ADA and cutting some fees and bureaucracies that involve food delivery. As stated in the text, the use of this app would benefit both customers, as well as restaurants and couriers. In other words, it is an app of great significance for society and for the Catalyst community.
a good app for make the world a little bit more fair for the working people.Drivers and restaurants.
The proposal has sections that paint conflicting pictures. The proposer fails to create trust; current operations should have a trail that can be easily directed to.

Experience claims don't gel. Is this a company with 200+ developers, or one person with 5 years programing experience? Where is it being launched? Who is the client for this white label software? There is huge money spent in marketing to win this space, how will you compete?

The proposer's role in DEB is not clear. It is mentioned as a product development manager in a Linkedin Profile with the same name. The proposer has not provided his linked profile. The Identity of the 200 developers to which the proposer is referring is also not clear. However, assuming that the claims are currently pending verification, it can be assumed that the proposer and his company have the capability to implement the proposal in the right earnest.

I believe that the team involved in creating the project is very solid. According to what has been said, there are more than 200 engineers with experience in the food industry and in blockchain. It is also important to note that they already have a certain investment in the idea, both financially and for apps already developed. However, programmers, designers and other types of professionals necessary for the smooth running of the project could also have been cited. In addition, it would be beneficial to include more information about the leaders of this team, there are 200 engineers, but which ones command, what exactly do they do? It is always good to have a more palpable sense of the professional trajectory of those involved. These are details that would improve a good impression that is already passed.
phd 5 years of experience in the sector.yes it can work.(just maybe in the future instead of pay in ada pay in the stable coin of ada)

The proposer failed to answer how a whitelabel solution would address the challenge goal and missed or ignored another great collaboration opportunity in the comment section. Core features for the drivers (e.g. global chat) further lack details on implementation and does not address regulations.

The information provides is not sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

Not clear how this project can compete in a space where billions of VC capital are competing. Even if technically it can be produced, there is no clear idea who the target market for this white label software is.

The project is complex with a multitude of steps and complete information on team size and the phases of development have not been given very clearly. There is no explicit commitment to open-source the software too. However, if the development process and the number of people working on it are clarified it will be simple to audit the progress and can monitor its implementation.

Regarding making the project happen, I see that everything is well underway. It is said directly, through topics, what benefits each type of user of the app would have (customers, delivery people or restaurant owners). This guides well what are the points to be worked on when building the app. It is also said how the financing money would be used, by parts, and how the actions would develop over the months. On this last point, in my opinion, it could have been more detailed, because the intervals mentioned are very long. In 12/18 months, many things happen, it would be beneficial to also understand what the order between them would be and so on.

solution: Create a white-label decentralized food app which directly connects consumers to restaurants.
experience: Platform in development by 200+ engineers with 10+ years experience in the food delivery, rideshare, cryptocurrency exchange/wallets.
